$schema.description: The https:// URL referencing the JSON Schema for the manifest.

manifestVersion.description: The version of the manifest schema this manifest is using. It should be '1.0'.

name.description: The display name for the publisher.

id.description: A unique identifier for this publisher in reverse domain notation. E.g: io.salestim

logo.description: The https:// URL to the publisher's logo.

websiteUrl.description: The https:// URL to the page that provides support information for the template.

privacyUrl.description: The https:// URL to the page that provides privacy information for the template.

termsOfUseUrl.description: The https:// URL to the page that provides the terms of use for the template.

templateConfiguration.description: Describes the template properties and associated policies.

approval.description: Describes approval policy for this template, when requested by an end-user.

requireApproval.description: Defines if the template enforces an approval flow. N.B: Bypassed if the approval team is not defined.

approvalTeam.description: Defines members of the approval team.

adoption.description: Defines a serie of 3 adoption emails to be sent after each provisioning using this template (TO: provisioned team's owners).

week1Subject.description: Adoption email subject for week 1. N.B: Not yet implemented.

week1Message.description: Adoption email body for week 1. N.B: Not yet implemented.

week2Subject.description: Adoption email subject for week 2. N.B: Not yet implemented.

week2Message.description: Adoption email body for week 1. N.B: Not yet implemented.

week3Subject.description: Adoption email subject for week 3. N.B: Not yet implemented.

week3Message.description: Adoption email body for week 1. N.B: Not yet implemented.

permanentMembership.description: Defines members and owners enforced globally for this template.

owners.description: Defines owners enforced globally for this template.

members.description: Defines members enforced globally for this template.

audienceTargeting.description: A targeting rule that defines who can use the template, based on the user profile data. See https://developers.salestim.com/nocodeapps/templatesaudiencetargeting

enabled.description: Defines if this targeting rule is enabled. See https://developers.salestim.com/nocodeapps/templatesaudiencetargeting

rules.description: Targeting rule to be applied. See https://developers.salestim.com/nocodeapps/templatesaudiencetargeting

id.description: A unique identifier for this template in reverse domain notation. E.g: com.example.myapp

language.description: The language tag of the template. This language tag is used to localize various contents, especially provisioning notifications to end-users.

enabled.description: Defines if the template is enabled.

version.description: The version of the template. Changes to your manifest should cause a version change. This version string must follow the semver standard (http://semver.org).

system.description: Defines if the template is considered as 'system'. System templates are automatically deployed to all customers.

singleton.description: Defines if the template is considered as 'singleton'. Singleton templates can only be used once to generate one and only one team.

categories.description: Defines the gallery categories where the template has to appear as an array of category tags. See https://developers.salestim.com/nocodeapps/manifestSchema

clonedTeam.description: Defines the contents that will be cloned from the source team as part of the provisioning process.

teamId.description: Id of the team to be cloned (GUID)

teamName.description: Name of the team to be cloned (GUID)

includeApps.description: Include apps from the source team during the cloning process

includeTabs.description: Include tabs from the source team during the cloning process

includeSettings.description: Include settings from the source team during the cloning process

includeChannels.description: Include channels from the source team during the cloning process

includeMembers.description: Include members from the source team during the cloning process

newTeam.description: Defines the various properties of provisioned teams from this template

namingConvention.description: Dynamic name of the team to be generated during the provisioning process. See https://developers.salestim.com/nocodeapps/templatesnamingconventions

emailConvention.description: Dynamic email nickname of the team's underlying group to be generated during the provisioning process. See https://developers.salestim.com/nocodeapps/templatesnamingconventions

descriptionConvention.description: Dynamic description of the team to be generated during the provisioning process. See https://developers.salestim.com/nocodeapps/templatesnamingconventions

welcomeMessageConvention.description: Dynamic welcome message to be published in the team's general channel during the provisioning process. See https://developers.salestim.com/nocodeapps/templatesnamingconventions

defaultName.description: Default team name suggested to end-user when requesting a new team using this template.

defaultDescription.description: Default team description suggested to end-user when requesting a new team using this template.

defaultWelcomeMessage.description: Default team welcome message suggested to end-user when requesting a new team using this template.

teamPrivacy.description: Defines the visibility status of provisioned teams from this template. Could be 'public' or 'private'.

addRequesterAsTeamOwner.description: Defines if the requester for a new team is automatically added as an owner of the new provisioned team.

initialization.description: Defines the initialization directives for the template, especially how a source team is automatically generated while adding this template.

structure.description: Defines the structure of a team that will be automaticaly generated during the template installation, and automatically associated as the 'clonedTeam' to this template. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/get-started-with-teams-templates#teams-template-capabilities

contents.description: Defines additional contents (such as planner plans) that will be automaticaly generated during the template installation, and automatically associated to the 'clonedTeam'.
